definition[0]: to prevent something from continuing in its usual way by causing problems
example[0]: Traffic was disrupted by a hoax bomb.
example[1]: Climate change could disrupt the agricultural economy.
definition[1]: to prevent a situation, event, system etc from working in the normal way
example[2]: Traders are worried that war would disrupt ocean shipping.
example[3]: The union have threatened to disrupt services if their members are not happy with the pay award.
